place.name: WITHIEL FLOREY
place.gazetteerText: WITHIEL-FLOREY, a parish in Williton district, Somerset; 8 miles NNE of Bampton r. station. Post town, Brompton-Regis, under Tiverton. Acres, 2,485. Real property, £1,564. Pop., 164. Houses, 23. The property is divided among a few. A portion of Brendon hill, with iron mines, is within the limits. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £59. Patron, A. Lethbridge, Esq. The church is old but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
